      • calcXIC

        public java.util.List<XICPeak> calcXIC(Spectra spectra)
        Description copied from interface: SpectralAnalyzer
        XIC is calculated over all retention time.
        XIC from specific range of retention time will be added in the future.
        Specified by:
        calcXIC in interface SpectralAnalyzer
        Returns:
        List of XICPeak

      • clacPIP

        public double clacPIP(Spectra spectra)
        Description copied from interface: SpectralAnalyzer
        This method estimates precursor purity based on isotope cluster around given m/z.
        Currently, it is not implemented.
        Specified by:
        clacPIP in interface SpectralAnalyzer
        Returns:
        precursor purity between 0 to 1. 1 is the best score.

      • extractGDFR

        public double extractGDFR(Spectrum_pre spectrum,
                          double tolerance,
                          double maxCharge)
        Description copied from interface: SpectralAnalyzer
        GDFR stands for Good Diff Fraction.
        It calculates the ratio of interpretable peaks as an amino acid over all peaks.
        Specified by:
        extractGDFR in interface SpectralAnalyzer
        Returns:
        fraction of interpretable peaks as an amino acid.

      • extractMaxSeqTagLength

        public int extractMaxSeqTagLength(Spectrum_pre spectrum)
        Description copied from interface: SpectralAnalyzer
        All possible tags will be estimated in a way of de novo.
        Notice that de novo method is inaccurate in general.
        Specified by:
        extractMaxSeqTagLength in interface SpectralAnalyzer
        Returns:
        maximum tag length obtained from the given spectrum.

      • extractTICFrac

        public double extractTICFrac(Spectrum_pre spectrum,
                             Spectra spectra)
        Description copied from interface: SpectralAnalyzer
        This method returns TIC divided by mean of TIC in given spectra.
        Notice that
        1) The TIC comes from a single spectrum.
        2) The mean of TIC comes from all spectra.
        Specified by:
        extractTICFrac in interface SpectralAnalyzer
        Returns:
        TIC / mean of All TIC.

      • extractXrea

        public double extractXrea(Spectrum_pre spectrum)
        Description copied from interface: SpectralAnalyzer
        Xrea is published in JPR.
        Dr. Na suggested that area of spectrum can be a measurement of spectral quality.
        Specified by:
        extractXrea in interface SpectralAnalyzer
        Returns:
        Xrea

      • extractSCA

        public double extractSCA(java.util.ArrayList<Peak> expPeaks,
                         java.util.ArrayList<Peak> theorPeaks,
                         double tolerance)
        Description copied from interface: SpectralAnalyzer
        SCA stands form Spectral Contrast Angle.
        In this method, however, peaks takes square root to avoid biased weight toward the highest intensity.
        Notice that SCA is invented to compare quality of experimental peaks based on theoretical peaks.
        Therefore, you MUST use theoretical peaks as contrast ones.
        Specified by:
        extractSCA in interface SpectralAnalyzer
        Returns:
        SCA
